Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Completely \Com*plete"ly\, adv. In a complete manner; fully. [1913 Webster]

completely adv 1: to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly'); "he was wholly convinced"; "entirely satisfied with the meal"; "it was completely different from what we expected"; "was completely at fault"; "a totally new situation"; "the directions were all wrong"; "it was not altogether her fault"; "an altogether new approach"; "a whole new idea" [syn: {wholly}, {entirely}, {totally}, {all}, {altogether}, {whole}] [ant: {partially}] 2: so as to be complete; with everything necessary; "he had filled out the form completely"; "the apartment was completely furnished"
